title: Sending Our Love to Los Angeles and How to Help
content:
As fires ravage Los Angeles, we want to extend our love to anyone who might find themselves affected by this disaster. Read on for some resources to help the people of LA…

01.09.2025: We’ll be updating this post as events warrant. There’s another wind event on the way on Monday and Tuesday of next week, but once the fires are extinguished, we’ll be sure to link with some local organizations and post more guidance.

Los Angeles was our home for five years and when you cut through all the glitz and glamour of Hollywood, you’ll find some of the best riding in the area. Thanks to orgs like the Lowelifes and Mount Wilson Bicycling Association. These two groups will be responsible for re-opening trails that were burned in the Eaton Fire.

Lowelifes

Mount Wilson Bicycling Association

We want to extend a hand of healing to our close friends who have lost their homes in Altadena.

Here are other organizations:

American Red Cross: You can support the Red Cross by making a donation online, by calling (800) 733-2767 or texting REDCROSS to 90999.

Bike Oven: You can donate basic hygiene products, toiletries, N95 masks or respirators, pet food, power banks, batteries, blankets and sleeping bags. Items can be dropped off at 3706 N. Figueroa St., Los Angeles 90065.

California Fire Foundation: An online monetary donation to the California Fire Foundation Wildfire and Disaster Relief Fund directly supports victims of wildfires and disasters throughout California, including the L.A. County area.

California Community Fund is accepting online donations.

Canine Rescue Club: You can apply to temporarily house an affected dog by filling out an online form.

GoFundMe has created a centralized online hub housing all verified fundraising pages related to the wildfires.

Direct Relief: Those interested in supporting wildfire response efforts can donate to Direct Relief’s Wildfire Response Fund online.

Salvation Army: The Salvation Army is currently accepting donations through the Emergency Disaster Fund to help meet the urgent need across Southern California. Monetary donations to directly aid the region can be made online.

AirBnB is offering free housing: 211LA.org.

Via Maxar Technologies, via Associated Press

 

 

If you are safe in Los Angeles and have other orgs who are helping, please drop them in the comments.
